/.title: Avalanche Prediction Project
/.content:
Alright, I'm testing again now that the link style is updated.

I guess notes need to be referenced somewhere to appear on the graph.

## Testing The CSV Table Output
I made a [[notes/Testing CSV Tables|a note]] to test out the Hugo shortcode for displaying tabular `.csv` data in this vault.

## Existing Capstone Project
We found the repo for [[notes/Drew Thayers Avalanche Prediction Capstone Project|Drew Thayers Avalanche Prediction Capstone Project]], which might be useful for seeing an existing example.

/notes/Drew-Thayers-Avalanche-Prediction.title: Drew Thayers Avalanche Prediction Capstone Project
/notes/Drew-Thayers-Avalanche-Prediction.content: [This capstone project](https://github.com/drewthayer/avalanche-prediction) from 2018 covers similar topics and could be useful as a reference.

/notes/Testing-CSV-Tables.title: Testing CSV Tables
/notes/Testing-CSV-Tables.content:
This is a test note. I'm going to refer to it from the main page.

# CSV Partial
I added a [Hugo HTML Partial](https://gohugo.io/templates/partials/) to `./layouts/partials` for displaying data in a `.csv` format. I'm going to use it now to see if it works and what it appears on the page as:

{{< csv-table csvFilePath="notes/csv/avalanche-danger-ratings-april-2023.csv" >}}

/notes/lowercase-test.title: lowercase test
/notes/lowercase-test.content: Does it only work if the filenames are lowercase?
